channel.title: Structure of CDWG Events on ASA Mathematical Sociology
channel.description: Recent content in Structure of CDWG Events on ASA Mathematical Sociology

item.title: BB - Brown Bag
item.description: BB is group meetings centered around group discussion or workshopping activities. This includes workshopping papers, research ideas, research plans etc. The first week of every quarter will be reserved for graduate students to write up a research plan for their graduate studies and/or updating their previously written plan.

item.title: RT - Research Talk
item.description: RT cover any area of current research that is of interest to computational demography (broadly defined).

item.title: PD - Professional Development
item.description: PD is group meetings centered around an internal or external speaker who will discuss oppertunities and experiences in academic, industry and non-profit sectors.

item.title: WS - Workshops
item.description: WS are dedicated to teaching new methods and models in demography and social sciences. This will focus on statistics and computational methods applied to demographic and health problems.

item.title: M - Miscellaneous
item.description: M are are uncatagorized activities that relate to Computational Demography.
